p:
Exponentiating the estimated β coefficients, e
β , obtains odds ratios interpretable as multiplicative effects on O( y
ij = 1). Odds ratios greater than 1.0 represent “positive” effects, meaning that higher values of an x variable are associated with higher odds that y = 1. Odds ratios below 1.0 represent “negative” effects, meaning that higher x values are associated with lower odds that y = 1.
